title: BI Developer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
**We are now looking for our next BI Developer!** 
 At Sambla Group, we thrive on data-driven decisions to propel our mission forward. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of innovation and empowerment. Our team is looking for a diligent and creative Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join us in transforming complex datasets into actionable insights. The successful candidate will work together with an aspiring Data team within the Architecture and Reporting function on a broad variety of projects providing strong career development opportunities.
   

  

**Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With**
* Stakeholder Engagement
* Data Translation and Communication
* Data Modeling
* Visualization Creation
* Data Transformation


 For this position, we see that you have at least a couple of years of experience within BI Development and business analytics. This positions puts an emphasis on understanding business needs and creating key data visualizations to drive our work forward with data driven decision making.
   

  

**Must Have**
* At least 3 years of theoretical education, preferably computer science
* At least one year work experience within BI Development and business analytics
* Advanced knowledge in SQL
* Experience from BI and analytics tools, specifically development in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, report building)


**A Bit Of Extra Credit If You Also Have**
* Experience in marketing analytics, for instance in campaign follow up, econometric modeling, customer segmentation and attribution modeling.
* Possess some experience in software development and be familiar with technologies such as Python, R, Git.
* Knowledge in advanced statistics and math (range from doing reporting to Data Science modeling and analytics)
* Experience in other BI and Analytics tools such as Qlik/Tableau/Looker.


**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: Full stack Developer, Totogi (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Totogi. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Totogi is on the lookout for tech trailblazers ready to dive headfirst into the next wave of software development with AI as their co-pilot. Think less routine, more innovation. Here, AI isn't just another tool—it's your sidekick, elevating your coding skills to superhero status. Imagine conjuring code like magic, predicting and squashing bugs before they even emerge, and delivering groundbreaking solutions that leave customers in awe.
   

  

 This role is all about pushing the boundaries of what's possible in software development. You'll be instrumental in crafting AI tools that clarify complex concepts, employing the latest in technology to upgrade your coding skills to superhero-level. Your objective is to elevate our enterprise software solutions, ensuring they lead the market in innovation, user satisfaction, and overall experience.
   

  

 Totogi values driven, curious, and innovative individuals ready to explore new horizons. We're charting a course towards a new way of working, with AI as our guide. Are you up for the challenge?
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI from the ground up in projects, enhancing everything from feature development to problem-solving.
* Crafting AI-generated summaries to streamline knowledge across products, domains, or corporate intelligence, boosting team efficiency.
* Showcasing the power of AI in improving software development processes, emphasizing its role as a booster, not a replacement.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Dwelling on manual debugging. With AI, identify and resolve issues swiftly, leaving outdated methods behind.
* Getting caught in the management trap. Concentrate on what you do best—coding and creating innovative solutions—rather than getting sidetracked by managerial tasks.


**Full Stack Developer Key Responsibilities**
* Drive the integration of AI into our development process, setting new standards in innovation, efficiency, and customer satisfaction for Totogi's product suite.


**Basic Requirements**
* Familiarity with different LLM architectures and the ability to select the most appropriate model for specific tasks
* The ability to integrate LLMs into DevOps pipelines
* Experience using LLMs for tasks like code generation, code completion, and automated code review
* The ability to integrate vector databases with LLMs for tasks like question answering or information retrieval


**About Totogi**
 Totogi is focused on building telco software for the public cloud and is completely redefining how carriers engage with their subscribers to drive customer love! We are a product-driven telco software company made up of some of the best minds from the telecoms industry and the brightest engineering talent across the globe. Change the game with us.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5260-SE-Stockhol-FullstackDevel

title: BI & Analytics Developer
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
 Our talented Data & AI team is made up of globally recognized experts and there's room for more analytical, innovative, client-driven data professionals! If you're passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let's talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.
   

  

**Come join us**
 If you’re passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let’s talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* You have extensive experience in database development mainly in SQL and working knowledge from T-SQL
* Knowledge of Power BI to enhance better data visualizations to the clients
* You have some experience in ETL tools and tabular/in-memory databases
* You have experience in analytical applications and dimensional data modelling
* You are experienced in both Azure and on-prem Microsoft platforms you are comfortable with DevOps
* You have worked with solution development (and design) either in an in-house role or as a consultant
* You speak fluently Swedish and English


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role:
   

  

* Collaborative, curious, client-centric
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Passionate about tech


**What You'll Do**
 As a BI and Analytics Developer you will:
   

  

* Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen
* Work with a team maintaining and developing an end-to-end enterprise data warehouse including integrations, data modelling, analysis tools and automated reports
* Work closely with the customer where mostly the solutions that the team is responsible for are business critical
* Take ownership of your own development tasks while collaborating with your team members
* You'll be working occasionally with Application Management, we work in a DevOps setup, mixing development and operations
* Work with and be specialized in Microsoft tools


**Learn more**
 Do you recognize yourself in this vacancy and would you like to meet us? Then apply today, we can't wait to hear from you!
   

  

 Even if you don't feel a complete match for this role, we would encourage you still to apply! We are constantly looking for new team members to join our growing Data & AI team.
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
**Some Of The Best Things About Working At Avanade**
* People-first culture that supports innovation and encourages people to move forward
* Knowledge development is our focus, and we ensure this both by offering formal training opportunities as well as informal evenings where peers share their knowledge
* With your passion, you can use the latest Microsoft technology to make a difference for our customers in the Enterprise market
* We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people. Everyone has a career adviser who will work with you to create a plan and guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer
* Working in a hybrid/flexible model


**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you'll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You'll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, but to also lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It's all here, so take a closer look! We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees.

title: Innovativa utvecklare till Scania I-Talent 2024
description:
För åttonde gången drar Scania i gång sitt uppskattade I-Talent Program! Detta är programmet för dig med ett stort driv att utvecklas, som gärna bidrar med nya idéer och som vill vara en del i arbetet med att driva omställningen mot en mer hållbar transportindustri! Tar du examen 2024 eller har max ett par års erfarenhet i din IT-karriär är detta för dig!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Scania CV Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Södertälje/Hybrid
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 September 2024
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Scania är ett av Sveriges största företag och erbjuder lastbilar och bussar för tunga transporter i kombination med ett bredd produktrelaterat utbud av tjänster. De har målsättningen att driva omställningen till ett hållbart transportsystem genom att utveckla säkra, smarta och energieffektiva transportlösningar som är bättre för både människor och vår planet. De har idag runt 50 000 medarbetare i cirka 100 länder och tillsammans med partners och kunder driver de omställningen mot en mer hållbar transportindustri och är både trendsättare och pionjärer inom elektrifiering och hållbara transportsystem.
 


  


 Tillsammans med flertalet andra I-talents kommer du erbjudas en unik chans att delta i ett program som kommer kickstarta din resa hos Scania. Du anställs i en specifik roll och tillhör ett team men varvar arbetet i din roll med träffar tillsammans med de andra I-talents. Programmet startar varje höst och är utformat för dig som är junior i din karriär och för att du ska få de bästa möjliga förutsättningarna att växa in i din roll. I-talent består, utöver arbete i ditt team, i huvudsak av tre delar - ”Learning your professional role”, ”Go-and-see” och ”Training”. Detta ger även mycket goda möjligheter att bygga ett bra nätverk inom Scania och förutom dina I-talents-kollegor och din närmsta chef tilldelas du även en buddy som kommer att finnas där för dig din första tid. Hos Scania erbjuds du en mångkulturell arbetsmiljö med ambitiösa kollegor och ett företag som satsar på sitt ledarskap. Här finns plats för alla att växa, oavsett om du vill vara generalist, specialist eller ledare. Har du rätt inställning och är motiverad att ta ansvar har du alla möjligheter att utvecklas!
 


  


  

**CI Machine-teamet**



  


 Som en del av detta team tillhör du Scania R&D och välkomnas till ett erfaret, kompetent och framåtsträvande team som jobbar med CI-Machine – en ny funktionalitet som kommer vara avgörande för Scanias ambition att vara marknadsledande när det gäller innovativa lösningar. Målet med CI-Machine är att skapa en automatiserad pipeline – en ”integration-as-a-service-lösning” som möjliggör för designers att bygga, konfigurera och utlösa tester för mjuk- och hårdvara inom hela Scanias modulsystem. Här jobbar du med CI/CD-utveckling i framkant och kommer arbeta fullstack med JAVA, Python och AWS som molnlösning. Med ditt arbete bidrar du i förlängningen till kortare ledtider inom produktionen, förbättrad miljöpåverkan och kostnadseffektivitet inom Scania såväl som Traton Group.
 


  


 Idag består teamet av 10 personer men det finns stora ambitioner att växa framåt, varav vi söker flera i-Talents till just det här teamet. Här välkomnas du till en mångkulturell grupp från hela världen som trivs tillsammans både på och utanför jobbet.
   




**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och ditt intresse för såväl tjänsten som Scania som företag. Vi söker efter engagerade och duktiga problemlösare som gärna kommer med nya idéer om hur saker kan förbättras och utvecklas. Det är av stor vikt att du har en god samarbetsförmåga och tar ett stort ansvar för ditt eget lärande. Gör du det finns oändliga möjligheter att utvecklas. Exempelvis har tidigare I-talents nu både ledar- och specialistroller!
 


  

  
* Har en akademisk utbildning inom IT
  
* Har grundläggande kunskaper inom något programmeringsspråk såsom JAVA eller python
  
* Har kunskaper inom eller intresse för att lära dig mer om testning
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i engelska
  
* Meriterande om du även har kunskaper i svenska
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Tester (problemlösning + personlighet)
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work.
  
* Intervju med Scania
  
* Referenser + beslut
  


  


  

**Övrigt information**



  

  
* Start: 1:a september 2024
  
* Omfattning: Heltid, visstidsanställning 6 månader med god chans till förlängning
  
* Placering: Södertälje och med möjlighet till distansjobb några dagar i vecka
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work. Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Emelie Säfbom, emelie.safbom@academicwork.se
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 Läs mer om Scania på deras hemsida!
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Emelie Säfbom eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn05@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105424

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
Early 2024, EQT and Adelis took a decisive step to jointly invest in HVD Group, further expanding our fantastic group with the addition of Next One Technology and Craftnote. HVD group provides cloud-based software to customers working in the field of installation and construction across Europe, offering modern solutions to an entire industry in dire need of digitalisation. Our mission is to enable and drive an industry transformation, enhancing efficiency and sustainability for all customer segments- one business at a time! We are currently 550 employees across the group, operating in the Nordics, Germany and UK, with well over 13 000 customers and 160 000 platform users
   

  

 As a group, all of our business units are currently undergoing a migration into a consolidated Salesforce.com CRM system, with part of the organization already live. As part of this migration process, we are looking to implement new best practices, processes and reporting standardisations across the entire group. In order to streamline this exciting journey, we are looking for an experienced Salesforce professional who is eager to be a part of our journey in defining, and building a best of breed system!
   

  

**Role description:**
 As a Salesforce developer you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of all our salesforce applications within HVD Group. Your primary focus will be custom Salesforce development and integration toward third-party services, providing guidance and support to ensure adherence to best practices. At times, this will include working with external consultants, and vendors in the integrations, and developments of the HVD Group Salesforce environment. You will be heavily engaged with various teams and stakeholders across the organization, hence it requires you to have a collaborative and problem solving attitude, where the commitment to creating quality products is essential.
   

  

**Responsibilities of this role include:**
* Translating functional requirements into technical requirements
* Designing and building high-performance, reusable, and reliable Apex code with best practices
* Ensuring the best possible quality and usage of the application
* Taking ownership of project work, and developing relationships across the organisation (should be a confident self-starter)
* Identifing bugs and aligning with requirements during debugging
* Test bug fixes to make sure they work as per requirements, then deploy them to production


**Skills and Qualifications required:**
* A bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Salesforce developer, including a strong understanding of the Salesforce platform, its architecture, and its limitations.
* Proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and other Salesforce development tools.
* Knowledge of web development technologies, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
* Salesforce developer certifications, such as Platform Developer I and II, are highly desirable.


 If you share our enthusiasm and vision but worry that your experience does not match all the specified qualifications, apply anyway! You may be the ideal candidate for this role or another in our ever-growing organization.

title: Senior Mobile Developer
description:
Ready to embark on our mission to deliver world-class apps and shape the future of mobile experiences? Look no further! App Shack, a trailblazing force in mobile app development, is on the hunt for a talented Senior Mobile Developer to join our growing team!
   

  

 Since launching in 2013, App Shack's primary mission has been to close the gap between great ideas and great tech. As a beacon in the mobile app development domain, we've consistently launched superior mobile applications. With our footprint spanning across Europe and North America, our dedication lies in evolving and addressing intricate technical challenges.
   

  

 Today, we're thrilled to offer a chance for you to be a pivotal part of our team as our new Senior Mobile Developer!
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Mobile Developer at App Shack, you'll collaborate with clients and coach fellow team members to create, maintain, and improve top-quality products. You and your team will work together to conduct product discovery, technical research, and workshops, as well as develop, test, and maintain code. You will get to know your clients and communicate with them throughout each project. In doing so, your team will create state-of-the-art apps and services, fitting your clients' needs.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 We prioritize finding individuals who share our values and are eager to learn and grow with us. This approach allows us to build a team that is not only talented and capable but also passionate and committed to our shared goals. You love what you do and take pride in writing clean and testable code, experimenting with new technologies, and always trying to improve. You look forward to working with your talented colleagues to build and maintain our client's products and to learn from their experiences.
   

  

**Ideally, You Have**
* Expertise in React Native and Typescript
* Knowledge of iOS and Android platform conventions, differences, and APIs
* Experience with automated testing suites, like Jest
* Experience with setting up CI/CD pipelines for mobile applications
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Ability to communicate ideas effectively and interpret the ideas of others
* Knowledge of mobile app development processes and lifecycles
* Proactive problem solver with attention to detail


**Equal Opportunity**
 App Shack is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, age, disability and family situation. We value diversity, and we expect the same from you.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 Ready to script a new chapter in your career with App Shack? Reach out! We’re reviewing applications continuously. Forget the formal cover letter – just share your LinkedIn profile link, and let's embark on this journey together!

title: Java Developer – Consumer Notifications
description:
Receiving parcels should be a joyful experience. Do you want to make everyday life easier and shape the digital user experience for millions of recipients? If so, this might be the perfect opportunity for you.
   

  

**About The Team And The Role**
 You will join an experienced team of engineers dedicated to delivering value through software craftsmanship. We believe in self-organizing teams and we get motivated by being accountable, with the pre-requisite that mandate must be in the team for how the solutions should be implemented. If you seek this position, you will be interviewed and evaluated by the team, we also choose our teammates.
   

  

 As a team we are guided by our users, stakeholders within the rest if Group IT, and the business units. When we get confused, we take a glimpse at the agile manifesto.
   

  

 The role as a software engineer in our team not only entails technical know-how, but also great communication skills, reaching out to other colleagues outside the team is one important thing being a developer.
   

  

 Follow us on LinkedIn and find out more
   

  

**About The Job**
 With over 245M traceable parcels and letters per year, our job is to notify recipients about important shipments events via app push, sms, email or letters. Our mission is to do so in the most reliable and user-friendly way possible.
   

  

 As a backend engineer you will work with infrastructure, microservices and scalable systems that must cope with high data traffic and complex logic for logistics.
   

  

**Some Of Our Technologies/techniques**
* Microservices/Serverless
* Typescript/Javascript
* Java (Spring Boot)
* Kubernetes
* NodeJS
* AWS - Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, S3, Kinesis to name a few
* Azure
* React, Vue 3
* Grafana, Loki, ELK


**Who are you?**
 Above everything else you love to code and your belief is that a good software architecture is developed, not specified, secondly you like Java and you think you are pretty good at it.
   

  

 Work-life balance is crucial for maintaining the energy needed to excel in your job. If you have hobbies and interests outside of work, we are eager to hear about them!
   

  

 The team is experienced but learning and being open to new things is very important, so we think that you are a person that likes to share mistakes and insights.
   

  

**You Have Knowledge And Experience Of**
* Java including Spring Boot
* AWS or similar cloud platforms (Azure, OpenStack or Google Cloud)
* High data traffic/load services
* 4-5 years of related work experience
* Academic education in computer science or equivalent experience
* English in speech and writing


**We offer you**
* Good work/life balance.
* Flexibility of working from our office or from a location of your choice
* To work with our modern tech stack with great opportunities to influence the choice of technologies used.
* Developing your technical skills. As an example, we sponsor you to get AWS certified.
* A job where the value you deliver is important to hundreds of thousands of users.
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and indoor swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord´s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
* Good occupational pension terms.
* To be a part of a really nice and supportive team.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com.
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Gustav Forsberg on gustav.forsberg@postnord.com
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: Facklig kontakt | PostNord
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 #

title: People Manager SE
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Head of Architecture and Development - Data Platform Sweden
   

  

 We are looking for a Head of Architecture & Development to join our Data Platforms unit in Sweden. As the leader, you will be responsible for managing a team of developers who are part of various development teams across multiple business areas and countries. In addition to your managerial duties, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our culture and driving our ongoing transformation efforts.
   

  

 Data Platforms is a service line within Tietoevry Industry, encompassing five Business Units that operate in diverse markets across multiple countries. Our services are utilized by over 4500 customers. While our primary focus is the Nordic countries, we have plans to expand our services globally.
   

  

 As a Unit, we have a total of 450 team members organized into five Business Units and four Horizontals, located in different countries such as Sweden, Norway, Finland, Poland, Czechia, Latvia, and India.
   

  

 As a Head of Architecture & Development your mission is to:
   

  

* Lead and oversee a team of developers in Sweden, providing guidance and direction to ensure efficient and high-quality work processes.
* Develop and nurture the skills and capabilities of the team members, fostering their professional growth and success.
* Collaborate closely with the development teams associated with each developer, understanding their needs, and providing support and resources as required.
* Play a pivotal role in the overall leadership team for Architecture & Development, contributing to the development and implementation of a positive and collaborative work culture.
* Actively participate in the ongoing transformation efforts towards adopting more modern and agile ways of working, leveraging the SAFe framework as a basis for these changes.


**Responsibilities**
* Lead, motivate, and coach the team of developers to achieve common goals and success.
* Manage and develop work processes and guidelines to ensure efficiency and quality.
* Identify and support individual development needs of team members, including implementing training plans and mentorship.
* Foster a culture of learning and knowledge sharing within the unit.
* Evaluate and recruit new talents to strengthen the team and meet competency needs.
* Collaborate closely with other departments and stakeholders to ensure seamless coordination of work and efforts.
* Effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including presentations, reports, and meetings.
* Monitor and drive the implementation of best practices in agile and software development.
* Actively participate in the ongoing transformation of work methods and culture within the organization.
* Promote and support the transition to agile practices and the utilization of the SAFe framework.
* Manage resistance and address change-related issues within the unit.
* Be responsible for achieving and exceeding set goals and key performance indicators for the Architecture & Development unit.
* Monitor and analyze performance against financial, time, and quality measures.
* Take action to ensure continuous improvement and delivery of high-quality solutions.


**Requirements**
* Strong leadership experience in driving IT units or departments
* Excellent IT delivery and management skills.
* Proficiency in developing business processes and implementing organizational changes.
* Strong team player with excellent relationship-building skills.
* Ability to create high-performing teams and foster cooperation and communication.
* Effective coaching and communication skills across different domains.
* Fluency in English and Swedish.


 What we offer
   

  

* Professional growth, meaningful projects, and a good work-life balance.
* Flexible working arrangements, including the ability to work remotely.
* Impactful work and the opportunity to contribute to society.
* International working environment with experienced colleagues
* Unique learning and growth opportunities.
* Inclusive and supportive community focused on diversity and innovation.
* Join a company with many satisfied customers.


**Did we inspire you?**
 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV, and we will contact you. Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager, Christer Hallberg, at christer.hallberg@tietoevry.com, og responsible recruiter Rojin Amini, at rojin.amini@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

*We conduct background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment agencies.*
*Tietoevry values diversity and welcomes applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for the better. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Guided by our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of corporate and public clients in over 90 countries. Tietoevry's annual turnover is approximately 3 billion euros, and the company's shares are listed on the NASDAQ Helsinki and Stockholm exchanges, as well as the Oslo Børs.

title: Global Product Safety Scientist
description:
**Company Description**
*Sobi offers the opportunity to work at an international pharmaceutical company focused on specialty pharmaceuticals meeting the high medical needs of rare disease patients and providing treatment and services to them. Our employees come from a variety of backgrounds within research, healthcare, industry and the academic sphere.*
**Job Description**
 The Global Safety Scientist has a key role within Global Pharmacovigilance & Patient Safety (GPV) and is responsible for providing scientific expertise to safety surveillance and risk management activities including signal detection and evaluation for assigned product(s), where Sobi is the marketing authorisation holder or has product(s) in clinical development. The role actively contributes to setting the strategic direction within GPV and to the development of safety standards and processes.
   

  

 As part of our PV team you will be working collaboratively with the Global Product Safety Science Lead (GPSSL) for assigned product(s) as well as with other PV functions, to ensure that safety surveillance activities are delivered to ethical and safety quality standards to ensure the safety of patients and to be in compliance with GVP, GCP and worldwide regulatory requirements. You will also be working cross functionally within the company and with 3rd parties.
   

  

 We are looking for a motivated and collaborative professional who will contribute to shaping our team, develop our systems and processes and drive effective collaborations across Sobi and with our partners.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 The Global Product Safety Scientist is directly responsible for providing scientific expertise to safety surveillance and risk management activities for one or more Sobi development and/ or marketed products. You will be part of a collaborative team made up of safety leads and safety scientists. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:
   

  

* For the assigned product(s) coordinate multidisciplinary product level Benefit Risk Team meetings for signal detection, analysis and validation, risk management and minimization strategies, risk communication, and safety labelling activities
* Contribute to clinical safety science interactions with partner companies for the product (if applicable) to ensure effective clinical safety science interactions including ensuring sharing of safety information per the SDEA and the collaborative functioning of the joint safety management team (JSMT)
* Create, extract and/or prepare all types of listings from data sources required from the Sobi Safety Database, or other applicable sources, for the purpose of signal detection, safety surveillance/analysis and regulatory submission activities.
* Lead the collection of material for periodic reports e.g. PSURs and DSURs and contribute to the risk evaluation and the benefit-risk assessment for the assigned product(s).
* Be main author and coordinator for the production and maintenance of core and EU RMPs and work with stakeholders to support the preparation and maintenance of local RMPs
* Provide high quality and timely contributions to responses to safety-related enquiries for Sobi products i.e. from regulatory authorities and other sources requiring input from GPV.
* Be the safety representative in clinical study teams, including providing safety input to design, conduct data analysis and interpretation. Work in close collaboration with PV Operations to ensure appropriate study case processing.
* Provide safety expertise to CTD submission, regulatory interactions and defence, and geo-expansion beyond initial License Applications (NDA/BLA) and MAAs
* In alignment with the GPSSL drive monitoring, aggregation, review, analyses, interpretation, and evaluation of incoming safety information and highlight potential safety signals
* Work collaboratively, effectively and flexibly with the GPSSL to complete safety deliverables and activities to ensure continuity of safety support
* Work across PV with the product assigned Partnership and Operations Manager to contribute to product specific case management guidance documents and trainings e.g. Product Safety Information
* Contribute to development and maintenance of safety related systems, processes, and procedural documents
* Support audits and inspections for pre-inspection requests as well as during audits and inspections


**Qualifications**
**Education/Learning Experience/Work Experience**
* University level qualification in biosciences, healthcare, or pharmacy. A PhD in a topic relevant to the position is preferred
* At least 3 years´ experience post graduation in the pharmaceutical industry, preferably in Patient Safety and/or Clinical/Drug Development, or at a regulatory agency
* Previous experience in pharmacovigilance, including advanced/solid knowledge of PV regulations and cross-functional working


**Skills/Knowledge**
* Analytical skills
* Ability to work proactively, independently, and collaboratively with colleagues
* Team-leadership capabilities.
* Relationship builder and collaborator within PV functions Experience, expertise, determination, and courage to solve problems or escalate issues as appropriate
* Effective communicator with peers, internally and with partner functions
* Preferred experience in process development, process implementation, training development and process oversight
* High quality written and spoken English


**Personal Attributes**
* Problem solver, developer of analysis and deliver plans. Proven delivery focus
* Effective team player


**Additional Information**
 All Sobi employees need to demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership. Are you ready to be on the Sobi team? Come join a culture that empowers every person to be the person that makes a difference for rare disease.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases, and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.
   

  

**An Equal Opportunity Employer**
 Sobi is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All employment decisions at Sobi are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veterans and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status or protected groups by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.
   

  

*Sobi is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. Disabled/Veterans. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access this website to apply for a vacancy as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by sending an email to talentacquisition@sobi.com.*

title: Danish Business Development Representatives to Reliable AB!
description:
Do you speak Danish and have an interest in customer relations and business development? If you are looking for a role where you can develop your sales ability and gain relevant experience, this is the role for you! Apply today as we work with ongoing selection.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Reliable AB
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Sales
 



  

**Extent :**
 Part time, 1-3 days a week, 50h/month minimum
 



  

**Start date :**
 End of August 2024
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Reliable AB staff develop their sales assignments with niche talent recruitment, directly from universities and colleges. They work in a youthful environment with unique conditions to be able to staff and optimize results for all types of sales assignments. Every customer contact is a marketing opportunity and they place great importance in the person who represents a customer always having a relevant education, knows the market, the company and the product it represents. In this role your main responsibility will be to book appointments for Reliable's customers, and offer them the best conditions for their business growth.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* **An exciting experience where you can develop your sales skills**
  
* **A dedicated consultant manager to help and guide you in your role and future career path**
  
* **A competitive salary with the possibility of a generous provision salary**
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Prospecting and lead generation: Identify and research potential clients or partners through various channels
  
* Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring exceptional service delivery
  
* Pipeline Management: Manage and update the CRM system, keeping accurate records of interactions, leads, and opportunities
  
* Booking meetings: Putting clients together with their prospects and organizing these meetings.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* An ongoing tertiary education, with at least one year left of studies, of at least 50% study rate
  
* High speaking and written proficiency in Danish
  
* An interest in business development, sales, and customer relations
  
* Previous experience from sales or customer service
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Self-developer
  
* Service-minded
  
* Results-oriented
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Reliable AB**

 Read more about Reliable AB here.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Emma Nydén or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sts05@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105334

title: Grid Manager - Offshore Wind
description:
Deep Wind Offshore is an international developer and owner of offshore wind projects, backed by strong industrial owners from the shipping/offshore and utility sectors. With a pipeline of more than 10 GW Deep Wind Offshore is so far developing offshore wind parks in Norway, South Korea and Sweden. The Company has entered joint ventures with EDF Renewables in Norway and bp in South Korea. Wherever Deep Wind Offshore operate, the goal is to be the preferred local developer. And with a strong focus on technology improvements, Deep Wind Offshore will provide opportunities for the local supply chain.
   

  

 Deep Wind Offshore sees large opportunities in the Swedish market for offshore wind power and has therefore launched a subsidiary in Sweden. With long coastlines and good wind resources, the conditions for offshore wind power are excellent in Sweden. In addition, the need for renewable energy is large and increasing. The availability of new renewable energy will be crucial for electrifying society and building new green value chains. Sweden realise the potential of offshore wind and are aiming for a total of 120 TWh over time. With projects of significant size, Deep Wind Offshore can be a major contributor to achieving these goals.
   

  

**We are now recruiting a Grid Manager in Electrical Power. An exciting opportunity to shape the offshore wind sector in Sweden!**
 You will be responsible for the design of grid connections and interfaces, studies and analyses as well as follow-up of suppliers and various stakeholders and partners. Including the overall electrical setup and infrastructure of the offshore wind farms. You will work with projects in all stages, from early prospects through to commissioning and beyond.
   

  

 Deep Wind Offshore is looking for an experienced and senior engineer who wants to work with electrical engineering in a developing and interdisciplinary environment. You have many years of experience and a burning desire to help shape the offshore wind sector together with a dedicated team.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
* Project Management related to power cables, substations, and grid connections of the offshore wind farms (OWF’s) Erik Segersäll and Olof Skötkonung.
* Follow-up of studies and work carried out internally as well as by external consultants engaged in the different work packages.
* Participate in and interface with the design of electrical infrastructure within the wind farms as well as the substations.
* Dialogue with internal and external stakeholders about needs, plans, risk and decisions related to power cables and connections.
* Identification of long lead items related to power cables and substations as well as of suppliers of such. Contact and follow up relevant suppliers, e.g. WTG, cables, substations etc.
* Responsible for the overall electrical power design of offshore wind farms
* Network connection and interface with network operator
* Communicate with internal and external stakeholders about needs, plans, risks and decisions
* Feasibility assessments when qualifying new sites and project opportunities in Sweden our other target markets
* Project finance, budget and reporting
* Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* Provide continuous feedback and improvements to development strategy, processes and other optimization opportunities.


**Candidate profile:**
* Electrical Engineer or equivalent
* Minimum of 5 years' experience from project management within electrical power
* Experience and knowledge in areas such as grids, substations and high-voltage cables
* Experience in design and analyses of power systems
* Experience from the wind power industry or other power production is a bonus
* Fluent in professional English, written and spoken


**Why Deep Wind Offshore?**
 By joining us, you will become a valuable and appreciated member at a company where everybody is passionate about contributing to making a difference towards a more sustainable world. You will have the opportunity to be a part of the DWO journey, where you will learn a lot and be given the possibility to influence our ways of working.
   

  

**Location:**
 Deep Wind Offshore's projects in Sweden are managed from the local office and the position will be placed in Stockholm, Gävle or Uppsala

title: Account Executive / Sales Director & Startup Founder
description:
**This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.** 




  





**Who you are** 




 You are a seasoned sales professional with a proven track record of success. Your expertise extends beyond simply closing deals; you possess the vision and leadership qualities to build a company from the ground up. Whether you're driven by disrupting new markets or leveraging your skills for positive global impact, this opportunity offers you the chance to become a CEO and co-found a groundbreaking company.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off August, 2024, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 August 19th, 2024
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:** 



* **Treyd:** 
 A buy-now-pay-later solution for supplier invoices.
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture

title: Senior Salesforce Consultant - Nordic Region
description:
We at 4C Nordics are looking for a Senior Salesforce Consultant that thrive with bringing companies and customers together. You love to juggle technology, business and people all at the same time. Become part of one of the leading Salesforce partners in EMEA and be responsible for designing and building scalable, best in class solutions for our customers. You will work across the Salesforce platform and other IT environments.
   

  

 You will very quickly sense the 4C vibe and become an important part of our 4C family. As person you thrive with freedom under responsibility and the flexibility to choose if you want to work from home or from the office.
   

  

 We are looking towards a very exciting future and are therefore looking for new skilled and talented colleagues for both Copenhagen and Oslo.
   

  

* Assist the commercial team in pre-selling and taking the requirements and translate these into tangible deliverables contributing client proposals
* Both delivering complex configuration yourself and managing the delivery of solutions through less experienced members of your project team
* Following the 4C project methodology to ensure project success. You will be responsible for making sure projects are delivered on time and to the clients/4C quality expectations, in a fast paced, Agile environment
* Going above and beyond for your customer with a can do attitude whilst remaining consultative and following Salesforce best practices
* Represent and promote the core company values
* Identifying opportunities for 4C to implement new solutions for customers
* Potentially act as a mentor to less experienced members of the team
* When acting in a lead role, update PMO on overall project status, risks, issues, budget
* Use the possibility to share as much knowledge as possible in 4C Nordics but also in the 4C group
* Travel in the Nordics or Europe are expected from time to time


**You Recognise Yourself In Most Of The Following Requirements**
* Experience in end to end Salesforce (SFDC) CRM implementations
* Experience working in a project oriented agile environment
* Experience in designing and developing software components
* You have experience from different sizes of companies plus line of industries
* Strong presentation and communication skills
* You know how to create trust and loyalty with your customer
* Strong customer facing skills, analytical approach to challenges and pro active mentality
* Salesforce Certified: App Builder/401 Developer or 201 Admin with either Sales or Service Cloud Consultant
* You know how important it is to share knowledge and get valuable knowledge in return
* It is important for you to have a good team and colleagues around you

title: Product Owner
description:
Are you passionate about IT, new technologies, and user experience? Scania's Devtools Group is seeking a Product Owner for our Gitlab area.
   

  

 Join our Development Tools & Techniques team, which supports the development cycle with tools like Jira, Gitlab, and Jfrog Artifactory. Our mission is to enhance the developer experience at Scania. You will be part of a dynamic group with portfolio manager, business developers, solution architects, product owners and, initiative leads all working in agile scrum teams. There are numerous opportunities for development in various technologies and fields, as we are a team with diverse expertise and experience
   

  

**Your role as Product Owner within Devtools**
* Maximize product value by prioritizing and defining EPICS/stories.
* Communicate with stakeholders to align product strategy and roadmap.
* Roadmaps and prioritized EPICS should be in line with prioritized initiative (Portfolio level)
* Develop and articulate product goals focused on user experience and value.
* Align product roadmaps with portfolio strategy and market trends.
* Monitor product delivery, timelines, KPIs, and budgets.
* Collaborate closely with developer communities and understand their workflows.
* Prioritize and convert EPICS into actionable stories.
* Participate in agile ceremonies and collaborate with the Technical Operations Manager.
* Support the scrum team by removing impediments and ensuring ROI.
* Promote automation and monitor platform performance.
* Develop user guidelines and collaborate with vendors to align with Scania's standards.


**About You**
 You are a knowledgeable and influential communicator with a flexible mindset. You excel in stakeholder management and enjoy working with both new product strategies and established services. You have 3-5 years of software development experience, ideally within larger organizations. Experience in roles such as Scrum Master or Product Owner is essential. Excellent English communication skills are required, both written and verbal. A degree in IT, computer science, engineering, or a related field is preferred. Experience with AWS and Git would be a plus.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 Enjoy competitive salaries, flexible hours, and access to educational programs for skill development. As a Scania employee, perks includes car leasing possibilities, performance bonuses, parental benefits, and access to various sports clubs. Plus, if you're in Stockholm, hop on our Scania Job Express for a direct commute between Stockholm and Södertälje, or work from offices right next to Sergels torg in central of Stockholm city.
   

  

 If you're excited about this opportunity, we would love to hear from you! For any questions please contact hiring manager Caroline Mortimer, caroline.mortimer@scania.com Background check might be conducted on the final candidate.

title: Junior Java-utvecklare
description:
Är du en driven och nyfiken backendutvecklare med cirka tre års erfarenhet inom javautveckling? Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och utvecklas i en dynamisk och stödjande miljö? Vi söker en junior Java-utvecklare som är redo att växa tillsammans med oss och bidra till innovativa projekt. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vidareutveckla dina färdigheter, lära dig av erfarna kollegor och arbeta i ett team som värdesätter samarbete och tydlig kommunikation. Om du har erfarenhet av Java, är en lagspelare och har en stark vilja att fortsätta utvecklas, då kan detta vara rätt roll för dig!
 



  





 Du kommer jobba i ett team som dagligen arbetar med utveckling av applikationer för kollektivtrafik. Arbetet inkluderar allt från att jobba med grundprodukten som baseras på mjukvara utvecklad via Open Source men också viss hantering av infrastruktur.
 



 Rollen är baserad i Malmö. Vi erbjuder våra anställda stor flexibilitet och en valmöjlighet att sitta större delen av sin tid på distans.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 



* Cirka 3 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
* Högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom systemvetenskap eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift



 Sen är det meriterande (men inte absolut nödvändigt) om du även…
 


* Har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta i team och därför kommunicerar enkelt och ärligt med dina kollegor
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Azure, Kubernetes och Terraform



  





**Mer om dig:** 




 Du tycker om att jobba i en teammiljö och bidrar alltid till gruppen, men kan också utföra uppgifter självständigt när det behövs. Du trivs med att hjälpa dina kollegor genom att svara på frågor och stötta där du kan. För att du ska trivas hos oss ser vi att du, precis som vi, uppskattar tydlig och rak kommunikation. Dessutom är du ivrig på att lära dig och utvecklas i din roll.
 



  





**Varför du ska välja Decerno** 




 I våra medarbetarundersökningar blir det gång på gång tydligt att det är de fantastiska kollegorna, de roliga och utmanande projekten och möjligheten att kunna bidra till samhällsnytta som gör att vi trivs så bra på Decerno.
 



  





 Sedan finns det också några ytterligare aspekter som vi som arbetsgivare ser som självklarheter:
 


* **En flexibel arbetsplats** 
 med större frihet att planera vardagen för att få arbete och privatliv att gå ihop.
* **Extra föräldraförmåner** 
 eftersom vi tycker att familjen är viktigast.
* **Kompetensutveckling** 
 : vi tycker att din kompetensutveckling är viktig! Därför anordnar vi interna utbildningar i vår egen Dec Academy, har bokklubbar och håller årliga konferenser.
* **Sociala aktiviteter** 
 : vi vill att du ska må bra, trivas och ha roligt på arbetet och därför arrangerar vi regelbundet olika sociala aktiviteter, utmaningar och hälsotävlingar – såväl virtuellt som på plats.



  





 Utöver detta erbjuder vi även ett brett förmånspaket som inkluderar bland annat friskvårdsbidrag och försäkringspaket. Vi berättar gärna mer om du vill veta vad mer vi på Decerno skulle kunna erbjuda dig.
 



  





**Har du tagit dig så här långt i annonsen berättar vi gärna lite mer:** 




 Vi är specialister på skräddarsydda digitala lösningar och vad betyder det tänker du? Det betyder att vi förstår att alla kunder är olika och har unika förutsättningar. Det betyder att vi skräddarsyr våra lösningar utefter kundens behov. Och det betyder att vi kan erbjuda våra medarbetare ett smörgåsbord av spännande projekt och tekniker.
 



  





 Samtidigt som vi skapar digitala lösningar vill vi också göra skillnad på riktigt. Det är inte bara något vi säger, vi menar det! Sedan vår start 1984 har vår etiska policy varit vår guide och vi väljer aktivt bort projekt inom vapenindustri, spel, tobak och alkohol. Till 2025 ska dessutom minst hälften av våra projekt knyta an till FN: s hållbarhetsmål.
 



  





**Känner du igen dig i ovan beskrivning?** 
 Tveka inte på att söka redan idag.

title: Backend-utvecklare till Crediflow!
description:
Är du en erfaren backend-utvecklare med gedigen kunskap inom C#? Söker du en möjlighet att ta nästa steg i din karriär hos ett familjärt bolag som ligger i framkant inom sitt område? Trivs du i en prestigelös arbetsmiljö och vill vara med och forma framtidens molntjänster? Då vill vi höra från dig!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Crediflow AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Täby
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Crediflow är en ledande aktör som levererar lösningar inom e-faktura och EDI till företag och myndigheter. Du erbjuds en spännande tjänst på ett företag som ligger i framkant inom sitt område. Idag hanterar Crediflow en stor del av alla fakturor som skickas och tas emot i Norden och andra länder.
   

 Sedan start har ambitionen varit att förenkla och effektivisera företagsprocesser, genom att förenkla utbytet av elektroniska dokument. Oavsett vem kunden vill skicka till eller ta emot ifrån erbjuder Crediflow ett enkelt och effektivt sätt att hantera företagens dokumentflöden på – hela vägen från order till betalning. Crediflows anpassningsbara och skalbara lösningar innefattar bästa praxis inom logistik, ekonomi och IT.
 


  


 I rollen som Backend-utvecklare är du en del av ett team med utvecklare i Helsingborg och Stockholm. Du blir en nyckelspelare i utvecklingen av Crediflows ledande molntjänst. Tjänsten innebär också att lyssna in och förstå verksamhetens behov och komma med förslag på lösningar och ändringar, för att sedan vara med och skapa dessa. Har du dessutom ett intresse och teknisk förståelse kring AI finns stora möjligheter att påverka företagets utveckling och användning inom detta framåt.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utveckling i C# i cloudbaserad miljö
  
* Skapa och förbättra ramverk i koden
  
* Vara delaktig i beslut rörande drift och utveckling av Crediflows cloudbaserade system
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling i C#, gärna inom produktutveckling
  
* Har en stark förståelse för development patterns och strukturdesign
  
* Är van vid att arbeta och optimera molnbaserade tjänster för att skapa effektiva och pålitliga system
  
* Talar flytande svenska
  


  


  

**Det är även meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* Erfarenhet av Python (helst inom AI) och frontendutveckling (t.ex angular)
  
* Erfarenhet inom design och optimering av databaser och SQL
  
* Erfarenhet från verksamhet med intensiva transaktionsflöden
  
* Erfarenhet av Agila arbetssätt
  


  


 I rollen som backend utvecklare kommer du själv få testa din kod, vilket sätter krav på en noggrannhet och en självkritisk förmåga. Som person ser vi att du är självgående och tycker om att se lösningar på problem.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Crediflow AB**

 Läs mer om Crediflow här !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Crediflow AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Elin Sjösten eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på ste03@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105141

title: Frontendutvecklare TypeScript och React
description:
**Är du en driven front-end-utvecklare i teknisk framkant som tycker om att jobba i team? Då kan programmerare på Binosight vara det rätta jobbet för dig!** 




  





**Detta är Binosight – bolaget du kommer att jobba på** 




 Binosight är ett SaaS-bolag som på kort tid etablerat en ny branschstandard för att mäta projektkvalitet i byggprojekt. Vi är i ett läge där vi nu går från startup till scaleup, växer stadigt och har stabila och långsiktiga ägare i ryggen. Redan finns ett flertal stora fastighetsbolag och byggentreprenörer på kundlistan.
 



  





 Hjärtat i vår verksamhet är vår egenutvecklade molntjänst PQi (Projekt Quality Index) som är utvecklad i samarbete med forskare och bransch. Det är en automatiserad enkätbaserad tjänst som våra kunder själva använder för att mäta hur deras projekt fungerar. Mätresultaten hjälper till att identifiera och åtgärda risker i projekten betydligt tidigare än andra metoder. Systemet är idag översatt till fjorton språk och siktet är inställt på en internationell marknad.
 



  





 Nu behöver vi stärka upp med en till front-end-utvecklare i
 **Uppsala eller Nynäshamn** 
 för att öka utvecklingstakten.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Du kommer i huvudsak att jobba frontend men det är bra om du också har erfarenhet av att utveckla fullstack, för förståelse av helheten. Du kommer att koda i TypeScript och främst använda React och Material-UI. Vi använder GraphQL/Relay som API.
 



  





 Som person är du social och uppskattar att jobba i team med andra. Du kommer att jobba tillsammans med en senior fullstack utvecklare som har ansvar för backend och som även kan guida och stötta dig i API och frontend. Du behöver ha känsla för form och design, förutom dina tekniska färdigheter.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder möjlighet till hybridarbete, med huvuddelen av arbetstiden på något av våra kontor i Nynäshamn eller Uppsala och viss del av tiden på distans.
 



  





**Krav/kvalifikationer** 




 Vi bedömer att du behöver ha minst ett par års erfarenhet av utveckling med React och TypeScript.
 



  





 Därutöver är det är meriterande om du har vana av GraphQL, versionshantering i GIT och Linux.
 



  





 Det viktigaste är att du har ett grundläggande driv och hela tiden söker ny kunskap och utvecklas. Vi ställer inga formella krav på utbildning. Troligen har du själv byggt appar och skaffat dig förståelse för helheten. Vi ser gärna att du kan visa upp arbetsprov på vad du åstadkommit.
 



  





 Känner du att detta är tjänsten för dig, att du har många av de kompetenser och erfarenheter vi söker, men inte alla? Tveka inte att höra av dig för ett samtal! Vårt teamtänk bygger på prestigelöshet, att vi täcker upp för varandra och tillsammans skapar den helhet som ger oss kraft att uträtta storverk.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* ett spännande bolag med internationella tillväxtplaner
* ett tajt och erfaret utvecklingsteam med kompletterande kompetenser
* en utvecklingsmiljö i teknisk framkant
* flexibla arbetsuppgifter med stor frihet och eget ansvar
* möjlighet till hybridarbete – viss del på kontoret och viss del på distans
* bra anställningsvillkor



  





***Om PQi***




*PQi är en enkätbaserad tjänst för att identifiera risker tidigt i byggprojekt. Den ger stöd för att vidta åtgärder innan projektet drabbas av onödiga kostnader, förseningar och olyckor. Tjänsten är utvecklad tillsammans med Byggherrarna och Luleå tekniska universitet. Mätområden är bl a projektets förutsättningar och funktion, samt arbetsklimat och säkerhetsklimatet. Resultatet presenteras på ett standardiserat sätt där man kan jämföra med och lära av branschstandard. Några av Binosights kunder är Fabege, Vestia, ByggPartner, Akademiska Hus, ByggDialog, Regionfastigheter Dalarna, Balticgruppen, Oljibe, Statens Fastighetsverk, Vasakronan och Trafikverket.* 




  





**Din ansökan** 




 Du är välkommen med Din ansökan senast 12e augusti. Dina ansökningshandlingar skickar du till
 **work@binosight.com** 
 och ska innehålla CV och ett personligt brev. Om du ansöker via Easy Apply på Linkedin kan du endast bifoga ett dokument, så slå då gärna ihop CV och personligt brev till en fil.
 



  





 För frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Marcus Grymmare på 076 167 39 31 eller marcus.grymmare@binosight.com
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan, vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

title: Senior utvecklare
description:
Centio är ett familjärt konsultbolag som strävar efter att tillsammans med våra kunder främja en hållbar samhällsutveckling. Med verksamhet över hela Sverige erbjuder vi expertis inom områden som ekonomi, inköp, administration, projektledning, tekniska tjänster och IT.
   

  

 Våra medarbetare är engagerade individer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Som en decentraliserad organisation arbetar vi i små, självstyrande team där medarbetarna har stort beslutsmandat. Detta ger varje individ möjlighet till både stort ansvar och frihet att själv påverka sitt arbete, sin personliga utveckling och arbetstiderna. Det som förenar oss är vår gemensamma vision att göra positiv skillnad i samhället och samtidigt ha roligt på resan!
   

  

 Vi söker en Senior utvecklare till Trafikmyndighet i Stockholm.
   

  

 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag. Du kommer vara anställd av Centio Consulting Group AB och arbeta som konsult.
   

  

 Tjänsten är på heltid,
   

  

 Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med kunden vilket ställer stora krav på flexibilitet och samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

**Uppdraget och arbetsområde**
 Myndigheten är den som har det övergripande ansvaret för att alla som bor i, eller besöker, regionen ska ha tillgång till en väl utbyggd, lättillgänglig och pålitlig kollektivtrafik. I myndighetens uppdrag ligger att bereda och verk­ställa beslut om inriktning och omfattning för en långsiktigt hållbar kollektiv­trafik. Dessutom ansvarar de för styrning och uppföljning av trafikdrift samt upprätthållandet av infrastrukturens funktion, säkerhet och värde. Varje dag reser mer än 700 000 personer med den allmänna kollektivtrafiken, det vill säga resor med tunnelbana, bussar, pendeltåg och lokalbanor.
   

  

 Inom myndighetens produktområde Särskilda Persontransporter finns dag digitala kanaler så som app och webbar och som via ett API lager kommunicerar med backend system.
   

  

 Förmåga till utveckling och anpassningar av detta API lager behöver stärkas för att möta planerad utveckling och löpande förbättringar inom detta område.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i som en del av det digitala kanalteamet med backend utveckling. I närtid ligger åtgärder för att öka trygghet för resenärer. API –lagret skrivs i C# men du behöver även erfarenhet av även andra programmeringsspråk då myndigheten har andra närliggande applikationer som baseras på Java. Du behöver kunna hantera devops både i windows, linux och docker miljö.
   

  

 Det är av stor vikt att konsulten har förmåga att arbeta självständigt men också som en del i ett team. Du behöver kunna designa lösningsarkitektur och förmedla kunskaper till övriga utvecklare. Du kommer rapportera till ledningsteamet för produktområdet. Vidare är erfarenhet av att arbeta med många integrationer och hög grad av kommunikativ förmåga viktig.
   

  

 För att lyckas med uppdraget bygger vårt arbete på vår värdegrund som sammanfattas med orden: Öppenhet, Kompetens, Pålitlighet, Samverkan.
   

  

**Krav (OBS, obligatoriska)**
 Minst 7 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av C#, .NET, Entity Framework, ASP.NET Core. Testramverk och testautomatisering
   

  

 Minst 7 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av Windows Server och Windows 10, MSSQL arkitektur och fråge-optimering samt T-SQL och klustring
   

  

 Minst 7 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av Kubernetes och Docker
   

  

 Minst 7 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av Unix/ Linux: Konfigurera nätverk och applikationer. Drift och övervakning. Scripting med bash samt Windows: Konfigurera nätverk och applikationer, IIS, services. Drift och övervakning. Scripting med powershell
   

  

 Minst 7 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av applikationsövervakning: ELK, Kibana, Opentelemetry
   

  

 Minst 7 års dokumenterad erfarenhet som utvecklare i Java och Python
   

  

 Minst 7 års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt inkl. Eventdriven arkitektur och Microservice arkitektur
   

  

 Minst 7 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av Azure Devops, Jenkins, TFS samt SW-utveckling med agila metoder, Gitflow, githubflow
   

  

 Minst 1 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av publika transporter och SUTI
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Minst 5 års erfarenhet av NoSQL programmering
   

  

 Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Kafka, RabbitMQ, Jetbrains Rider, Gherkin/Cucumber
   

  

 Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av Frontendutveckling React, CSS, html programmering , Java script och CMS Orchard, Episerver
   

  

 Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Bankid
   

  

 Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Helm charts, Terraform
   

  

**Om oss**
 Centios övergripande mål är att vara ett konsultbolag som erbjuder smarta och hållbara lösningar som utvecklar samhället på ett positivt sätt.
   

  

 Våra medarbetare erbjuds villkor som är anpassade för individen. Det innebär att arbetstider, arbetsomfattning, arbetsplats och kompetensutveckling så långt som möjligt anpassas utifrån medarbetarens behov.
   

  

 Bland våra medarbetare hittar du engagerad personer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Vi jobbar i små grupper där du kan bidra med dina erfarenheter samtidigt som du får ta del av andras kunskap och erfarenhet.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt med välmående och att hitta en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Därför har vi en nollvision mot stress och sätter trivsel och hälsa främst.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på centio.se.
   

  

**Vänligen skicka ditt CV på svenska.**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Konsultuppdrag | Fullstack Webbutvecklare (JS, React, React Native, Typescript)
description:

 De viktigaste teknikerna som personen behöver ha koll på är:

 Bonus om personen också kan:

  Vi söker dig som är social, kommunikativ och gillar att jobba i team med andra. Du har minst 5+ års erfarenhet av webb/mobil-utveckling. Utöver det ser jag gärna att personen är kommunikativ, självgående, svensktalande och villig att arbeta på kontoret 3 dagar i veckan.
